fi.vincit.multiusertest.rule

Class AuthorizationRule

  • java.lang.Object
    • fi.vincit.multiusertest.rule.AuthorizationRule
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.junit.rules.TestRule

    public class AuthorizationRule
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.junit.rules.TestRule

    Rule to be used with MultiUserTestRunner to define whether a test passes or fails. Before a method to be tested is executed expect(Authentication) should be called with the identifiers or expectation.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AuthorizationRule

        public AuthorizationRule()

    • Method Detail

      • expect

        public AuthorizationRule expect(Authentication identifiers)
        Simple assertion for checking that method throws/doesn't throw an exception. If after the call no exceptions are expected the dontExpectToFail() has to be called. To expect a custom exception, setExpectedException(Class) can be used.
        Parameters:
        identifiers - Identifiers for which the calls after this method are expected to fail.
        Returns:
        AuthorizationRule for chaining calls
        Since:
        0.1

      • expect

        public void expect(Expectation expectation)
            throws java.lang.Throwable
        Advanced assertion which makes use of expectations to form Expectations. Immediately executes the call to the given method and applies defined assertions. Using this method, the dontExpectToFail() method isn't required to be called to call other methods that are not expected to fail.
        Parameters:
        expectation - Expectation rule
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - If error occurs
        Since:
        0.2

      • setRole

        public void setRole(UserIdentifier identifier)

      • setExpectedException

        public void setExpectedException(java.lang.Class<? extends java.lang.Throwable> expectedException)
        Set a custom exception to expect. Works only with expect(Authentication) method (version 0.1 style simple assertion).
        Parameters:
        expectedException - Exception class to except

      • apply

        public org.junit.runners.model.Statement apply(org.junit.runners.model.Statement base,
                                               org.junit.runner.Description description)
        Specified by:
        apply in interface org.junit.rules.TestRule

      • dontExpectToFail

        public void dontExpectToFail()
        Checks that if any previous calls should've failed and throws AssertionError if the calls haven't behaved as expected. If unexpected exception is thrown, throws RuntimeException. After this call don't expect any call to fail.
